episodes.description: Bill is joined by Andy, a fellow Faith Assembly Cult Survivor. They discuss the horrors of growing up in that cult. Its intense. Don't miss this one! episodes.title: 152 Sheryl Ruthven and her Doomsday Cat Cult, Part 2
episodes.description: You want cats? WE GOT CATS! LOTS of them! Sorry, not sorry for the cliffhanger though! And part 2 is MUCH more intense than part 1. In this chilling conclusion to our two-part deep dive into Sheryl Ruthven’s dark world, we follow her as she launches the notorious cat cult—a bizarre and twisted extension of her control. Ruthven forced her followers to take in up to 30 cats each, demanding they prioritize these animals over their own families. With mounting financial demands and increasingly strange rituals, her grip tightened, driving her followers deeper into her warped and evolving religion. Join us as we uncover the full extent of Ruthven’smanipulation and the devastating fallout that followed. Got a beer you want Doug toreview? Send him an email at ckcbeer@gmail.com Any other podcastcorrespondence, send it to ckcbpodcast@gmail.com https://www.instagram.com/crimeskillerscultsandbeer/ https://twitter.com/CKC_Beer https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUyuqDB2Dlszhpc_pGca29w https://www.facebook.com/groups/257328477392782/

episodes.title: 151 Sheryl Ruthven and her Doomsday Cat Cult Part 1
episodes.description:
In this episode, we welcome back SANDRA! She is the current co-host of CKCB. She's had things going on, causing her absence, but she is BACK for the ATTACK!


In this episode, we cover Sheryl Ruthven, a cult leader who never had any religious training...A hypocrite in everything, meaning she twisted religion to suit her needs...from sexuality to murder. She would preach against homosexuality, but engage in it. She also tried her best to get her ex husband/baby daddy murdered, in the name of God. Then came the cats! Just listen!


We cover her rise to cult leader, and the beginnings of herinsanity. Here kitty kitty kitty!


ALSO… Doug pays tribute to Todd in his Beer of the Week segment. Plus, he and Sandra talk about 2 nights with Metallica!!!

episodes.title: 148 Cult! Jane Whaley and the Word of Faith Fellowship
episodes.description:
NOTE: This episode was recorded prior to April 25, when Todd died. The previous episode was recorded after, because I wanted to address his death on the next episode that I released. Kevin from History Goon once agains joins Bill on this one, and as of the time of release, Kevin’s podcast, History Goon has been released! Show link is with the links below.

In this episode of Crimes, Killers, Cults and Beer, we take a deep breath and dive into one of the most disturbing and controlling religious movements in modern America — the Word of Faith Fellowship, led by the iron-fisted Jane Whaley. From her pulpit in Spindale, North Carolina, Whaley built a cult cloaked in Christianity, where members endured public beatings, emotional manipulation, and “blasting” prayers that sounded more like exorcisms than sermons.

We break down Jane’s rise from math teacher to spiritual dictator, the shocking allegations of abuse and isolation, and the hold she maintained over followers for decades — even banning laughter, music, and contact with the outside world. It’s a tale of spiritual control, psychological domination, and the terrifying power of blind faith.
Grab a beer — you’re gonna need it — and join us as we pull back the curtain on the Word of Faith Fellowship cult, where salvation came with a side of fear.

History Goon Podcast https://open.spotify.com/show/5rFF8rzQPpRxvp3AQSobVe?si=ae033047e806492d

episodes.title: 147 Clarence  'Preacher'  Heatley aka 'The Black Hand of Death'
episodes.description:
In this episode, we're cracking open a cold one and getting into the twisted saga of Clarence “Preacher” Heatley — a man whose nickname made him sound like a man of God, but whose actions were straight out of hell. Preacher wasn’t just a gangster — he was the head of a ruthless criminal enterprise that ran Harlem like a sermon soaked in blood.
From kidnapping and extortion to drug dealing and murder, Heatley’s Preacher Crew turned fear into currency and loyalty into a death sentence. We’re talking about a guy who turned a hotel into his personal torture chamber and handed down his own brand of justice like it was gospel. You’ll hear how he rose to power, what brought him down, and why his story still sends a chill down New York’s spine.
We also have sad news, regarding Todd, the first CKCB co-host, and we’re joined once again by History Goon, Kevin Carleton...And, he has an announcement! 

Bill’s Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/ckcbill

episodes.title: 141 CULT! David Berg and Children of God
episodes.description:
David Berg was a cult leader that emerged from the Pentecostal movement in the early 1900s. His parents were both evangelists, who preached the faith healing doctrine. As a kid, he was abused by a babysitter, which resulted in him becoming s-xually super charged for the rest of his life. 
He got into ministry as well, and was heavily influenced by William Branham early on. He set up a hippie type church, that combined hippie culture with the Branham message. But as time went on, he became focused on s-x, which would later include relations with everyone, even children. 
He wound up fleeing the US, and would fund his cult by forcing the women to go out and seduce men for money, a practice that he called flirty fishing. 
He would do no time, and died in Portugal. The cult is still active today under the name The Family International. There's alot more to the story, so join us!


Got a beer you want Doug to review? Send him an email at ckcbeer@gmail.com

episodes.title: CKCB Features 9 Acting Lab Senior Ensemble Cult Survivor, Al Tessier
episodes.description:
Some cults aren’t religious. Tonight, on CKCB Features,  I’m talking with a survivor named Al Tessier, who was part of the Acting Lab Senior Ensemble. An acting class, led by a Hollywood reject, who later turned his organization into a cult. This is a fascinating story that reminds us to be vigilant in any situation that is led by a charismatic figure. Small cults can be extremely damaging.

Check out Al’s podcast, Chatterbox https://open.spotify.com/show/2OvAXZE5Upenv1NzQGr7HM

episodes.title: CKCB Features Ep 7 Interview With Richard Kiers, Author and Survivor of the Movement of God Cult
episodes.description:
The second interview I’ve done with a cult survivor. Richard Kiers, who I talked about in Episode 118, The Movement of God cult. He fills in the details on his story, and he’s written a book about his experience. We also discuss cults in general. 
It was a great interview. His book is a very good read, and you can get it here:
https://www.amazon.com/Swindled-Faith-Reconciliation-Richard-Kiers/dp/0228815088/ref=sr_1_1?crid=2GDW14417KILU&dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.TWXXHbz1Eaf_VTB4zc-FF1GmmGereIbnnpFeslpESkIv2qgF0ctLYbIWkP2L2e3wnTtVjlqV_qG1Xi09hwrxOamaVi5-5vmlyonvHkwrKlG7vjxsNDTsMVpbR1H4Z4Anksq70wKyVqMtmQo0628xXQ.pG6AMYV8CkrNzeLMrp2F6X4E5JQI06Xoy4UR1kZAWLI&dib_tag=se&keywords=richard+kiers&qid=1723953272&sprefix=%2Caps%2C118&sr=8-1

episodes.title: 123 Insane Canadian Cult, His Rest Christian Fellowship Part 2 : Interview with a Survivor
episodes.description:
Tonight, we’re going back to the Canada binge, and episode 104, the Insane Canadian Cult, His Rest Christian Fellowship, led by sadistic cult leader, Rima Ailing. She was horrible. I recommend you go back and listen to that episode before listening to this one, if you haven’t yet. 
But the story didn’t end when Ep 104 did. It went on for another 20 years, and I’m joined tonight by Desti, who was born into this cult to the Haywards, who talked about (Not very nicely) in Ep 104. She is Nate’s little sister.
She bravely tells her story about growing up in the cult in its second chapter, and in many ways, the second chapter was worse than the first. BUT, this story has the most satisfying end of any cult story I’ve ever heard. 
Desti is amazing, and I admire her. So, once again, buckle up for an insane story, but at least this one has a happy ending.

Part 1: https://www.ckcbpodcast.com/104-insane-canadian-cult-his-rest-christian-fellowship/

episodes.title: 122 CULT! Word of Life Christian Church and the Death of Lucas Leonard, With Grinding True Crime
episodes.description:
Joining us tonight on CKCB is Todd, of the Grinding True Crime Podcast. We’re covering the Word Of Life Christian Church cult, led by Jerry and then Tiffanie Irwin. It was located in Chadwicks NY, and it was a particularly nasty cult, with all the trappings of one of the craziest. And it escalated as time went on, gradually getting worse and worse, until things exploded in 2015 with the brutal and
torturous death of 19 year old Lucas Leonard, at the hands of the cult leader, both his parents, and half sister. 




Check out Grinding True Crime on Apple or wherever you get your podcasts!

episodes.title: 118 CULT! The Movement of God and Sam Fife
episodes.description: Tonight, we’re doing a cult! A lesser known cult that had its roots in the US, Canada, and elsewhere. A cult that had its own troubled teen industry camps set up to reprogram people...mostly kids who didn’t tow the line of the doctrine. Sam Fife, and The Movement of God cult started in the early 1970s. It hit its peak in the late 70s, and ran strong into the 2000s, where it mostly fizzled out. This was a nasty one. It preached a sinless perfection doctrine, where in order to be a chosen one, you had to be completely without sin. But the cult leaders and elders were the ones who got to define what sin was. Child abuse was the norm, and pedophilia was blamed on the young female victim. They also taught faith healing. None of the leaders ever were brought up on criminal charges, but the survivors of this cult have ALOT to say. So, join us in this episode. Its a good one. The Jane Tapes https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sl2dmeLTt_A&t=654s https://www.ckcbpodcast.com/ https://www.instagram.com/crimeskillerscultsandbeer/ https://twitter.com/CKC_Beer https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUyuqDB2Dlszhpc_pGca29w https://www.facebook.com/groups/257328477392782/ #TrueCrime #TrueCrimePodcast #TrueCrimeComedy #TrueCrimeComedyPodcast #TrueCrimeCommunity #SerialKiller #Cult #CrimesKillersCultsandBeer #TheMovementOfGod #SamFife #BuddyCobb #FaithHealing

episodes.title: 104 Insane Canadian Cult, His Rest Christian Fellowship
episodes.description:
Hey, everybody...This week’s episode was an absolutely horrific story. Canadians do their cults crazy. The first one that comes to mind is the Anthill Kids. This cult isn’t that bad, but it is in the Gertrude Baniszewski and Mother Anna’s House of Prayer level of depravity. Its called His Rest Christian Fellowship, and there is literally nothing online about it that I could find other than a 2 minute news story from when they were arrested. I found the book when I was looking for a Canadian cult to cover. 
This story of course has a crazy woman who thinks she’s God’s prophet, and there is lots of abuse at her hands, plus insane interpretations of the bible. There are also vulgar displays of judicial malpractice, although the police did a great job getting these people to the courtroom. It also has 2 incredibly brave kids. So, give it a listen, and tell someone about it. 
And this is a case of be careful what you wish for, because it was absolutely horrible. Paul and I were pissed off pretty much the entire episode. But this case needs to be better known. We are the first podcast to cover it, and I want other podcasts to cover it too. Also, I’m including the link to the book because there’s a lot that I left out.

episodes.title: CKCB Features Ep 2: TTI With Survivor, Nora
episodes.description:
NOT A NEW EPISODE! I changed the name to Features, and it saved it to the top of the feed.








Welcome back, Nora Ashleigh! She was our guest on episode 73 and 74, where she told the extremely tragic, yet ultimately inspiring story of her experience in the clutches of the Troubled Teen Industry.



In this episode, we discuss the TTI itself, and it was a very enlightening and empowering episode. There's alot you don't know that you should know.



Also, at the end of the episode, we have Bill's original song that he wrote about TTI called Troubled So They Say. 



So, Join us!

episodes.title: 100 The Source Family Cult: Sex, Drugs, and More Sex and Drugs
episodes.description:
Welcome to Episode 100! We made it! And, to celebrate, we’re covering a hippie trippy drug cult. The Source Family. A cult that began when hustler/con artist, James Baker opened a health food store in California, in the 60’s. With his money and fame from that, he discovered the grooviness of drugs, and began considering himself to be a guru. He ran those stores into the ground, and opened The Source, which was a health food restaurant. The stars of the time loved his health food restaurant. It was the place to be for A list Hollywood elites. He taught the teachings of the Age of Aquarius, and whatever else he dreamed up.



He would later change his name to Father Yod, and amassed a following of over 200 people, crammed into small houses. And as time went on, he got crazier and crazier, forcing orgies on his entire clan. His own version of faith healing was the gospel as well. It became a psychedelic boot camp of sorts. He also decided he deserved multiple wives, because he was God. 



If there was any kind of legacy left behind, it was the music. He had a psychedelic traveling band, that made multiple albums, which are the Holy Grail to music collectors today. 



Run out of California due to allegations of underage liberties, he fled to Hawaii, where his life ended in one of the more creative ways for a cult leader to die.



Let’s get Trippy Culty!








Facebook CKCB Discussion Pub (https://www.facebook.com/groups/257328477392782/)

episodes.title: 54 Cult! Warren Jeffs and FLDS Part One
episodes.description: Today, we start a 2 part episode on Warren Jeffs and the Fundamental Church of Latter Day Saints cult. An off shoot from the Mormon church that occurred when the Mormons banned multiple wives. Warren's father, Rulon Jeffs became the prophet, and Warren was the heir apparent. Rulon made him the principal of a FLDS school, where Warren began crafting his warped view of Mormonism, and indoctrinating the students. When Rulon died, Warren assumed the role of prophet, and not only amped up the multiple wives, he also brought in child brides, and began trafficking young girls to creepy bootlicker men in the cult. He also instituted a set of the most draconian laws imaginable. Women were nothing more than breeding stock.   Join us as we destroy this creep. Its a very rough story, but we get through it by brutally mocking Warren. Part 2 comes next Saturday.  Twitter Facebook Instagram Website

episodes.title: 16 RG Stair and Overcomer's Ministry Doomsday Cult
episodes.description: Holy moly! Another little known cult that should be well known.  RG Stair started a world wide media empire on AM radio, then on the internet, and made millions. He also had a commune where his followers liquidated every thing they owned to move to the South Carolina commune...and gave all the money to RG to live in squalor and slave 7 days a week for no pay...all to be safe from Armageddon. RG had a prophet complex, he was a narcissist, and an over all piece of garbage. And he also liked the young girls. This story has a twist too, when a well known hip hop artist joined the ranks.  How this cult slipped under the radar is beyond me. Grab a beer. Its gonna get culty.Say What You Mean podcast, referenced several times on this episodeOur website. Find all episodes, and platform links for most platforms there, as well as Bill's music and Todd's band

episodes.title: 11 Hobart Freeman and Faith Assembly Cult Part 2: Bill's Story
episodes.description: Here it is, the conclusion of the 2 part series on the Faith Assembly Cult. This is Bill's experience as a member. From the moment his family joined, to the point where the church fell apart, and everything in between. He also tells how being in the cult affected him in adolescence and adulthood.  Don't miss this one...Although if you haven't listened to part 1, you should go back and listen to it first.If you are in this or any cult, and you want answers and help, contact Joshua Wilson. He is a Faith Assembly survivor as well, and he has helped lots of people get back into their lives.Social:https://mobile.twitter.com/CKC_Beerhttps://www.facebook.com/CKCBPChttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNlMRL0bKGMjmQbpxv4GwPQTodd's Band, and Bill's music:https://www.facebook.com/RADlikethe80shttps://open.spotify.com/artist/34eWK88psoEpApXis1taB1?si=13l_qSYLQcOfo6AwXbuiOA

episodes.title: 10 Hobart Freeman and Faith Assembly Cult Part 1
episodes.description: We're into double digits! And, we're covering our first cult!Faith Assembly, led by Hobart Freeman was active in the 70's and 80's. They believed among other things that God would heal anything wrong with you, and going to doctors was a sin.  The church had a very high body count of people dying of preventable ailments. And, if you died, it was because your faith wasn't strong enough, and you had unconfessed sin. They also believed that only the people in their church were going to heaven. Pair that up with isolating the congregation from their friends and families, and you're in for a world of shit. It had satellite branches all through the US and in several other countries. But, the kicker? It is still active. Buckle up. You're in for a hell of a ride!Part one is the story of Hobart Freeman and Faith Assembly. Part 2 is Bill's experience growing up in this cult.Shout outs this episode: Timesuck, Seven Deadly Sinners, Monsters of the Midwest, Human MonstersAvanah Sophia's MusicOur social media:TwitterFacebookYouTubeInstagramBill's musicTodd's band

episodes.title: 22 Dwight York and Nuwaubian Nation Cult
episodes.description: Lets get Culty! In this episode, we cover a cult leader with more origin stories than Sybil had personalities. Dwight York was a racist jerk who believed that his religion was the only one getting to Heaven, and that black people were the only pure people. He also had people believing that he was Egyptian royalty, a Native American chief...and an alien. Oh...And, he also liked kids a little too much. But this one has a very satisfying ending. Click Here for our website. Links to all episodes, Todd's band and Bill's music.

episodes.title: 41 Mother Anna's House of Prayer (Cult of abuse and depravity)
episodes.description: Wow, people! This episode was by far the worst cult we've covered. And, it happened in our home state of Florida. This is a relatively unknown case as well.  The cult has most of the boxes checked to identify a religious cult. But, it has a twist. The cult leader is a woman. She unleashed hell on her followers, who believed that she was literally God. Its a brutal story, and this bitch got what she deserved in the end. So, buckle up! Its a bad one. NOTE: We were supposed to have Wayne from the Florida Men on Florida Man podcast with us. There were technical difficulties and it wasn't able to happen. But, it will happen soon with a different topic.  Click here for our website. It has links to our social media, links to all streaming platforms, Bill's original music, and merch soon. Twitter Facebook

episodes.title: 46 Teenage Sex Cult and Music: Sergio Andrade and Gloria Trevi
episodes.description: We have a doozy for you today. A teenage sex cult, run by pedophile Mexican music producer, Sergio Andrade, and his biggest star, Gloria Trevi. Sergio was VERY good at developing female pop acts in Mexico. He had several platinum artists under his belt, and he was very well respected. Everything he touched turned to gold platinum. He was a gifted musician, and producer, and he had a knack for finding every client’s individual strong spot, and he would bring this out in them. His record speaks for itself. But, if that’s all he did, he wouldn’t be featured on CKCB. He had a taste for underage girls, and married one of his acts. He was also an abusive tyrant prick. But once he discovered Gloria Trevi, and she became Mexico’s top selling pop act of all time, he used his resume to entice many more young girls into his clutches, under the promise that he would “make them a star!” Before too long, he had a harem of girls that he was physically and sexually abusing, and he became the target of an international manhunt. One of his ‘clients’ who got the hell away from him was instrumental in bringing him down. Her courage is very admirable. Join us as we tell this riveting and unbelievable story.

episodes.title: 38 The Kurim Case: Crimes, Cannibals, Cults and Bull$hit
episodes.description: This is a bizarre case. It takes place mainly in the Czech Republic, in 2007, but it bounces around in a weird game of cat and mouse. It was the biggest story in that part of the world for a very long time, as new wrinkles came to light. It has child abuse, obscure cults, cannibalism, and a girl who was sex trafficked, rescued, then vanished. But, things aren't always what they seem. Or, are they? This story begins when a video baby monitor being used by new parents picked up a stray signal from a similar device nearby. It showed a small naked boy, lying bound on the bare floor of a dark room with no windows. The new father called police, and the events that happened next over a few months are the most peculiar things you've ever heard, with one of the craziest endings of any true crime story.  Join us as we take you on this roller coaster ride of a case. Click here for our website. It has links to all our episodes on multiple platforms. It also has links to our social media, Bill's original music, and we will have merch soon. Our social media: Twitter Facebook

episodes.title: 55 Cult! Warren Jeffs and the FLDS Part Two
episodes.description: Here we are again with the conclusion of our thrashing of this pedophile scumbag cult leader. In this episode, we discuss his cross country run from the FBI, and his hypocritical activities that he indulged in along the way. His reasoning? He was learning about the evil world so he could better protect his followers. We also cover his arrest and trials, as well as his hilarious desperate attempt to maintain control of the cult while behind bars.  Follow us on social media, and say hi!  Facebook Twitter Instagram Website

episodes.title: 61 Heavens Gate: The Crazy Comet UFO Cult
episodes.description: Another guest on the show, and another cult! We're covering Heaven's Gate, the Crazy Comet Cult. We discuss Marshall Applewhite and Bonnie Nettle's background, and how they took this from a crazy idea to a legit cult that had close to 50 people when it ended. It ended of course, when the majority of the cult all committed suicide to advance to "The Next Level" which was a planet where they would live for eternity in an existence devoid of personality, feelings, and sex. These people bought in 100% to the teachings, believing that Applewhite and Nettles were the second coming of Jesus Christ, who had the tickets to leave Earth and go away in a spaceship to a better eternity, and that the only way to get there was to off yourself. Castrations not withstanding.  We're joined by Dr Paul Meckes of the Conscious Radio Network, and their podcast, The Weekly Séance, on YouTube, Spotify, and all other platforms. He was awesome, and I'm sure he will be back soon.  Follow us on Facebook Twitter

episodes.title: 73 The Troubled Teen Industry Exposed With Nora Ashleigh Part 1
episodes.description: Sorry about the confusion. We uploaded the unedited file accidentally! Its fixed now! We have a special one for you tonight. 16 year old Nora Ashleigh was taken from her bedroom at 3AM and taken into the wastelands of Utah, where she was abused and subjected to all types of cruelty, and even torture. She endured this for 2 years until she finally escaped, and never looked back. But this wasn't a kidnapping or human trafficking incident. This was done at the request of her own parents. The people who took her were part of a goon squad, that worked for the Troubled Teen Industry. Isolation camps used to reeducate teens with issues. Issues in most cases that were the result of bad or lazy parenting. And, this is all 100% legal, and in many cases backed by the government. Many politicians and celebrities have dumped their teenage children off on these legalized gulags.  This is a multi million dollar industry, that still exists right now, and it isn't going away any time soon. Now 36 years old, Nora has taken the fight to them, and has become an activist against these organizations, whose practices would be shut down if it was a cult, or a far right militia camp or religious fundamentalist group.  Hundreds of deaths are on the hands of these groups, yet the victims get swept away, and not one of them has been held accountable. Part one is Nora's personal experience at the hands of these sadists. Part two is her escape, and all she and other survivors are doing to raise awareness.  Click here for Nora's website She is launching a podcast, which we'll have the link for in part 2.  Facebook Twitter(X) Instagram Patreon Discord Website

episodes.title: 74 The Troubled Teen Industry with Nora Ashleigh Part 2
episodes.description: In part 2, Nora tells us how she escaped the TTI, and her experiences being homeless afterward, and how her life ultimately came together. She then tells us how she became an activist against the industry, and what her future plans are.  Nora's website   Twitter(X) Instagram Facebook Discord Patreon YouTube Website

episodes.title: 82 Duped By An Angel: Lou Castro and Angels Landing Cult Part 1
episodes.description:
Lou Castro (Real name, Daniel Perez) was a con man, and he was really good at it. Before too long into adulthood, he began concocting an unbelievable story that would rope in the unsuspecting and people who were at the end of their rope.



He began telling people that he was an angel, and that he was 1000 years old...Or several thousand years old...Or, that he had powers to see into the future and prophecy when people would die. He could also raise the dead. He could also bring people back from the dead. He himself had come back to life. Whatever he needed the story to be was what it was, and his small group of cultists believed every word of it. 



But, he needed money, and lots of it. So, he talked his members into taking out huge life insurance policies on themselves, and then they would die, and Lou got all the money. 



He had a compound in Kansas, nice cars, and he and everyone else were living large. 



He also convinced them that he had to have sex with as many young girls as possible, so he could continue to be immortal. 



This guy was a total douchebag

episodes.title: 83 Duped By An Angel: Lou Castro and Angels Landing Cult, Part 2
episodes.description:
We're wrapping up the 2 part. If you thought part one was crazy, just wait till you hear this one.



The wheels on the bus are coming off as a rock star detective sets his sites on Lou, knowing that something was off about him. He is determined to see this through till the end.



We examine Lou's hold on his followers, and the body count increases. We cover the police work that led to the fall of Angels Landing, with the help of 2 of his victims, and a remarkable man who came into the life of one of them.



We conclude with his insane trial, and his idiotic attempts to make the judge and jury believe that he was in fact an angel....with very selective memory.
